Browse the source code of netbsd/objdir.amd64/crypto/external/bsd/heimdal/bin/hxtool/hxtool-commands.c

1#include <stdio.h>
2#include <krb5/getarg.h>
3#include <krb5/sl.h>
4#include "hxtool-commands.h"
5
6static int
7cms_create_sd_wrap(int argc, char **argv)
8{
9 struct cms_create_sd_options opt;
10 int ret;
11 int optidx = 0;
12 struct getargs args[] = {
13 { "certificate", 'c', arg_strings, NULL, "certificate stores to pull certificates from", "certificate-store" },
14 { "signer", 's', arg_string, NULL, "certificate to sign with", "signer-friendly-name" },
15 { "anchors", 0, arg_strings, NULL, "trust anchors", "certificate-store" },
16 { "pool", 0, arg_strings, NULL, "certificate store to pull certificates from", "certificate-pool" },
17 { "pass", 0, arg_strings, NULL, "password, prompter, or environment", "password" },
18 { "peer-alg", 0, arg_strings, NULL, "oid that the peer support", "oid" },
19 { "content-type", 0, arg_string, NULL, "content type oid", "oid" },
20 { "content-info", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "wrapped out-data in a ContentInfo", NULL },
21 { "pem", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "wrap out-data in PEM armor", NULL },
22 { "detached-signature", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "create a detached signature", NULL },
23 { "signer", 0, arg_negative_flag, NULL, "do not sign", NULL },
24 { "id-by-name", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "use subject name for CMS Identifier", NULL },
25 { "embedded-certs", 0, arg_negative_flag, NULL, "don't embed certificates", NULL },
26 { "embed-leaf-only", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "only embed leaf certificate", NULL },
27 { "help", 'h', arg_flag, NULL, NULL, NULL }
28 };
29 int help_flag = 0;
30 opt.certificate_strings.num_strings = 0;
31 opt.certificate_strings.strings = NULL;
32 opt.signer_string = NULL;
33 opt.anchors_strings.num_strings = 0;
34 opt.anchors_strings.strings = NULL;
35 opt.pool_strings.num_strings = 0;
36 opt.pool_strings.strings = NULL;
37 opt.pass_strings.num_strings = 0;
38 opt.pass_strings.strings = NULL;
39 opt.peer_alg_strings.num_strings = 0;
40 opt.peer_alg_strings.strings = NULL;
41 opt.content_type_string = NULL;
42 opt.content_info_flag = 0;
43 opt.pem_flag = 0;
44 opt.detached_signature_flag = 0;
45 opt.signer_flag = 1;
46 opt.id_by_name_flag = 0;
47 opt.embedded_certs_flag = 1;
48 opt.embed_leaf_only_flag = 0;
49 args[0].value = &opt.certificate_strings;
50 args[1].value = &opt.signer_string;
51 args[2].value = &opt.anchors_strings;
52 args[3].value = &opt.pool_strings;
53 args[4].value = &opt.pass_strings;
54 args[5].value = &opt.peer_alg_strings;
55 args[6].value = &opt.content_type_string;
56 args[7].value = &opt.content_info_flag;
57 args[8].value = &opt.pem_flag;
58 args[9].value = &opt.detached_signature_flag;
59 args[10].value = &opt.signer_flag;
60 args[11].value = &opt.id_by_name_flag;
61 args[12].value = &opt.embedded_certs_flag;
62 args[13].value = &opt.embed_leaf_only_flag;
63 args[14].value = &help_flag;
64 if(getarg(args, 15, argc, argv, &optidx))
65 goto usage;
66 if(argc - optidx > 2) {
67 fprintf(stderr, "Arguments given (%u) are more than expected (2).\n\n", argc - optidx);
68 goto usage;
69 }
70 if(argc - optidx < 1) {
71 fprintf(stderr, "Arguments given (%u) are less than expected (1).\n\n", argc - optidx);
72 goto usage;
73 }
74 if(help_flag)
75 goto usage;
76 ret = cms_create_sd(&opt, argc - optidx, argv + optidx);
77 free_getarg_strings (&opt.certificate_strings);
78 free_getarg_strings (&opt.anchors_strings);
79 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pool_strings);
80 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pass_strings);
81 free_getarg_strings (&opt.peer_alg_strings);
82 return ret;
83usage:
84 arg_printusage (args, 15, "cms-create-sd", "in-file out-file");
85 free_getarg_strings (&opt.certificate_strings);
86 free_getarg_strings (&opt.anchors_strings);
87 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pool_strings);
88 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pass_strings);
89 free_getarg_strings (&opt.peer_alg_strings);
90 return 0;
91}
92
93static int
94cms_verify_sd_wrap(int argc, char **argv)
95{
96 struct cms_verify_sd_options opt;
97 int ret;
98 int optidx = 0;
99 struct getargs args[] = {
100 { "anchors", 'D', arg_strings, NULL, "trust anchors", "certificate-store" },
101 { "certificate", 'c', arg_strings, NULL, "certificate store to pull certificates from", "certificate-store" },
102 { "pass", 0, arg_strings, NULL, "password, prompter, or environment", "password" },
103 { "missing-revoke", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "missing CRL/OCSP is ok", NULL },
104 { "content-info", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "unwrap in-data that's in a ContentInfo", NULL },
105 { "pem", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "unwrap in-data from PEM armor", NULL },
106 { "signer-allowed", 0, arg_negative_flag, NULL, "allow no signer", NULL },
107 { "allow-wrong-oid", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "allow wrong oid flag", NULL },
108 { "signed-content", 0, arg_string, NULL, "file containing content", NULL },
109 { "help", 'h', arg_flag, NULL, NULL, NULL }
110 };
111 int help_flag = 0;
112 opt.anchors_strings.num_strings = 0;
113 opt.anchors_strings.strings = NULL;
114 opt.certificate_strings.num_strings = 0;
115 opt.certificate_strings.strings = NULL;
116 opt.pass_strings.num_strings = 0;
117 opt.pass_strings.strings = NULL;
118 opt.missing_revoke_flag = 0;
119 opt.content_info_flag = 0;
120 opt.pem_flag = 0;
121 opt.signer_allowed_flag = 1;
122 opt.allow_wrong_oid_flag = 0;
123 opt.signed_content_string = NULL;
124 args[0].value = &opt.anchors_strings;
125 args[1].value = &opt.certificate_strings;
126 args[2].value = &opt.pass_strings;
127 args[3].value = &opt.missing_revoke_flag;
128 args[4].value = &opt.content_info_flag;
129 args[5].value = &opt.pem_flag;
130 args[6].value = &opt.signer_allowed_flag;
131 args[7].value = &opt.allow_wrong_oid_flag;
132 args[8].value = &opt.signed_content_string;
133 args[9].value = &help_flag;
134 if(getarg(args, 10, argc, argv, &optidx))
135 goto usage;
136 if(argc - optidx > 2) {
137 fprintf(stderr, "Arguments given (%u) are more than expected (2).\n\n", argc - optidx);
138 goto usage;
139 }
140 if(argc - optidx < 1) {
141 fprintf(stderr, "Arguments given (%u) are less than expected (1).\n\n", argc - optidx);
142 goto usage;
143 }
144 if(help_flag)
145 goto usage;
146 ret = cms_verify_sd(&opt, argc - optidx, argv + optidx);
147 free_getarg_strings (&opt.anchors_strings);
148 free_getarg_strings (&opt.certificate_strings);
149 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pass_strings);
150 return ret;
151usage:
152 arg_printusage (args, 10, "cms-verify-sd", "in-file [out-file]");
153 free_getarg_strings (&opt.anchors_strings);
154 free_getarg_strings (&opt.certificate_strings);
155 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pass_strings);
156 return 0;
157}

159static int
160cms_unenvelope_wrap(int argc, char **argv)
161{
162 struct cms_unenvelope_options opt;
163 int ret;
164 int optidx = 0;
165 struct getargs args[] = {
166 { "certificate", 'c', arg_strings, NULL, "certificate used to decrypt the data", "certificate-store" },
167 { "pass", 0, arg_strings, NULL, "password, prompter, or environment", "password" },
168 { "content-info", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "wrapped out-data in a ContentInfo", NULL },
169 { "allow-weak-crypto", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "allow weak crypto", NULL },
170 { "help", 'h', arg_flag, NULL, NULL, NULL }
171 };
172 int help_flag = 0;
173 opt.certificate_strings.num_strings = 0;
174 opt.certificate_strings.strings = NULL;
175 opt.pass_strings.num_strings = 0;
176 opt.pass_strings.strings = NULL;
177 opt.content_info_flag = 0;
178 opt.allow_weak_crypto_flag = 0;
179 args[0].value = &opt.certificate_strings;
180 args[1].value = &opt.pass_strings;
181 args[2].value = &opt.content_info_flag;
182 args[3].value = &opt.allow_weak_crypto_flag;
183 args[4].value = &help_flag;
184 if(getarg(args, 5, argc, argv, &optidx))
185 goto usage;
186 if(argc - optidx < 2) {
187 fprintf(stderr, "Arguments given (%u) are less than expected (2).\n\n", argc - optidx);
188 goto usage;
189 }
190 if(help_flag)
191 goto usage;
192 ret = cms_unenvelope(&opt, argc - optidx, argv + optidx);
193 free_getarg_strings (&opt.certificate_strings);
194 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pass_strings);
195 return ret;
196usage:
197 arg_printusage (args, 5, "cms-unenvelope", "in-file out-file");
198 free_getarg_strings (&opt.certificate_strings);
199 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pass_strings);
200 return 0;
201}

203static int
204cms_envelope_wrap(int argc, char **argv)
205{
206 struct cms_envelope_options opt;
207 int ret;
208 int optidx = 0;
209 struct getargs args[] = {
210 { "certificate", 'c', arg_strings, NULL, "certificates used to receive the data", "certificate-store" },
211 { "pass", 0, arg_strings, NULL, "password, prompter, or environment", "password" },
212 { "encryption-type", 0, arg_string, NULL, "enctype", "enctype" },
213 { "content-type", 0, arg_string, NULL, "content type oid", "oid" },
214 { "content-info", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "wrapped out-data in a ContentInfo", NULL },
215 { "allow-weak-crypto", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "allow weak crypto", NULL },
216 { "help", 'h', arg_flag, NULL, NULL, NULL }
217 };
218 int help_flag = 0;
219 opt.certificate_strings.num_strings = 0;
220 opt.certificate_strings.strings = NULL;
221 opt.pass_strings.num_strings = 0;
222 opt.pass_strings.strings = NULL;
223 opt.encryption_type_string = NULL;
224 opt.content_type_string = NULL;
225 opt.content_info_flag = 0;
226 opt.allow_weak_crypto_flag = 0;
227 args[0].value = &opt.certificate_strings;
228 args[1].value = &opt.pass_strings;
229 args[2].value = &opt.encryption_type_string;
230 args[3].value = &opt.content_type_string;
231 args[4].value = &opt.content_info_flag;
232 args[5].value = &opt.allow_weak_crypto_flag;
233 args[6].value = &help_flag;
234 if(getarg(args, 7, argc, argv, &optidx))
235 goto usage;
236 if(argc - optidx < 2) {
237 fprintf(stderr, "Arguments given (%u) are less than expected (2).\n\n", argc - optidx);
238 goto usage;
239 }
240 if(help_flag)
241 goto usage;
242 ret = cms_create_enveloped(&opt, argc - optidx, argv + optidx);
243 free_getarg_strings (&opt.certificate_strings);
244 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pass_strings);
245 return ret;
246usage:
247 arg_printusage (args, 7, "cms-envelope", "in-file out-file");
248 free_getarg_strings (&opt.certificate_strings);
249 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pass_strings);
250 return 0;
251}
252
253static int
254verify_wrap(int argc, char **argv)
255{
256 struct verify_options opt;
257 int ret;
258 int optidx = 0;
259 struct getargs args[] = {
260 { "pass", 0, arg_strings, NULL, "password, prompter, or environment", "password" },
261 { "allow-proxy-certificate", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "allow proxy certificates", NULL },
262 { "missing-revoke", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "missing CRL/OCSP is ok", NULL },
263 { "time", 0, arg_string, NULL, "time when to validate the chain", NULL },
264 { "verbose", 'v', arg_flag, NULL, "verbose logging", NULL },
265 { "max-depth", 0, arg_integer, NULL, "maximum search length of certificate trust anchor", NULL },
266 { "hostname", 0, arg_string, NULL, "match hostname to certificate", NULL },
267 { "help", 'h', arg_flag, NULL, NULL, NULL }
268 };
269 int help_flag = 0;
270 opt.pass_strings.num_strings = 0;
271 opt.pass_strings.strings = NULL;
272 opt.allow_proxy_certificate_flag = 0;
273 opt.missing_revoke_flag = 0;
274 opt.time_string = NULL;
275 opt.verbose_flag = 0;
276 opt.max_depth_integer = 0;
277 opt.hostname_string = NULL;
278 args[0].value = &opt.pass_strings;
279 args[1].value = &opt.allow_proxy_certificate_flag;
280 args[2].value = &opt.missing_revoke_flag;
281 args[3].value = &opt.time_string;
282 args[4].value = &opt.verbose_flag;
283 args[5].value = &opt.max_depth_integer;
284 args[6].value = &opt.hostname_string;
285 args[7].value = &help_flag;
286 if(getarg(args, 8, argc, argv, &optidx))
287 goto usage;
288 if(help_flag)
289 goto usage;
290 ret = pcert_verify(&opt, argc - optidx, argv + optidx);
291 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pass_strings);
292 return ret;
293usage:
294 arg_printusage (args, 8, "verify", "cert:foo chain:cert1 chain:cert2 anchor:anchor1 anchor:anchor2");
295 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pass_strings);
296 return 0;
297}

299static int
300print_wrap(int argc, char **argv)
301{
302 struct print_options opt;
303 int ret;
304 int optidx = 0;
305 struct getargs args[] = {
306 { "pass", 0, arg_strings, NULL, "password, prompter, or environment", "password" },
307 { "content", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "print the content of the certificates", NULL },
308 { "never-fail", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "never fail with an error code", NULL },
309 { "info", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "print the information about the certificate store", NULL },
310 { "help", 'h', arg_flag, NULL, NULL, NULL }
311 };
312 int help_flag = 0;
313 opt.pass_strings.num_strings = 0;
314 opt.pass_strings.strings = NULL;
315 opt.content_flag = 0;
316 opt.never_fail_flag = 0;
317 opt.info_flag = 0;
318 args[0].value = &opt.pass_strings;
319 args[1].value = &opt.content_flag;
320 args[2].value = &opt.never_fail_flag;
321 args[3].value = &opt.info_flag;
322 args[4].value = &help_flag;
323 if(getarg(args, 5, argc, argv, &optidx))
324 goto usage;
325 if(argc - optidx < 1) {
326 fprintf(stderr, "Arguments given (%u) are less than expected (1).\n\n", argc - optidx);
327 goto usage;
328 }
329 if(help_flag)
330 goto usage;
331 ret = pcert_print(&opt, argc - optidx, argv + optidx);
332 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pass_strings);
333 return ret;
334usage:
335 arg_printusage (args, 5, "print", "certificate ...");
336 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pass_strings);
337 return 0;
338}

340static int
341validate_wrap(int argc, char **argv)
342{
343 struct validate_options opt;
344 int ret;
345 int optidx = 0;
346 struct getargs args[] = {
347 { "pass", 0, arg_strings, NULL, "password, prompter, or environment", "password" },
348 { "help", 'h', arg_flag, NULL, NULL, NULL }
349 };
350 int help_flag = 0;
351 opt.pass_strings.num_strings = 0;
352 opt.pass_strings.strings = NULL;
353 args[0].value = &opt.pass_strings;
354 args[1].value = &help_flag;
355 if(getarg(args, 2, argc, argv, &optidx))
356 goto usage;
357 if(argc - optidx < 1) {
358 fprintf(stderr, "Arguments given (%u) are less than expected (1).\n\n", argc - optidx);
359 goto usage;
360 }
361 if(help_flag)
362 goto usage;
363 ret = pcert_validate(&opt, argc - optidx, argv + optidx);
364 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pass_strings);
365 return ret;
366usage:
367 arg_printusage (args, 2, "validate", "certificate ...");
368 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pass_strings);
369 return 0;
370}

372static int
373certificate_copy_wrap(int argc, char **argv)
374{
375 struct certificate_copy_options opt;
376 int ret;
377 int optidx = 0;
378 struct getargs args[] = {
379 { "in-pass", 0, arg_strings, NULL, "password, prompter, or environment", "password" },
380 { "out-pass", 0, arg_string, NULL, "password, prompter, or environment", "password" },
381 { "help", 'h', arg_flag, NULL, NULL, NULL }
382 };
383 int help_flag = 0;
384 opt.in_pass_strings.num_strings = 0;
385 opt.in_pass_strings.strings = NULL;
386 opt.out_pass_string = NULL;
387 args[0].value = &opt.in_pass_strings;
388 args[1].value = &opt.out_pass_string;
389 args[2].value = &help_flag;
390 if(getarg(args, 3, argc, argv, &optidx))
391 goto usage;
392 if(argc - optidx < 2) {
393 fprintf(stderr, "Arguments given (%u) are less than expected (2).\n\n", argc - optidx);
394 goto usage;
395 }
396 if(help_flag)
397 goto usage;
398 ret = certificate_copy(&opt, argc - optidx, argv + optidx);
399 free_getarg_strings (&opt.in_pass_strings);
400 return ret;
401usage:
402 arg_printusage (args, 3, "certificate-copy", "in-certificates-1 ... out-certificate");
403 free_getarg_strings (&opt.in_pass_strings);
404 return 0;
405}

407static int
408ocsp_fetch_wrap(int argc, char **argv)
409{
410 struct ocsp_fetch_options opt;
411 int ret;
412 int optidx = 0;
413 struct getargs args[] = {
414 { "pass", 0, arg_strings, NULL, "password, prompter, or environment", "password" },
415 { "sign", 0, arg_string, NULL, "certificate use to sign the request", "certificate" },
416 { "url-path", 0, arg_string, NULL, "part after host in url to put in the request", "url" },
417 { "nonce", 0, arg_negative_flag, NULL, "don't include nonce in request", NULL },
418 { "pool", 0, arg_strings, NULL, "pool to find parent certificate in", "certificate-store" },
419 { "help", 'h', arg_flag, NULL, NULL, NULL }
420 };
421 int help_flag = 0;
422 opt.pass_strings.num_strings = 0;
423 opt.pass_strings.strings = NULL;
424 opt.sign_string = NULL;
425 opt.url_path_string = NULL;
426 opt.nonce_flag = 1;
427 opt.pool_strings.num_strings = 0;
428 opt.pool_strings.strings = NULL;
429 args[0].value = &opt.pass_strings;
430 args[1].value = &opt.sign_string;
431 args[2].value = &opt.url_path_string;
432 args[3].value = &opt.nonce_flag;
433 args[4].value = &opt.pool_strings;
434 args[5].value = &help_flag;
435 if(getarg(args, 6, argc, argv, &optidx))
436 goto usage;
437 if(argc - optidx < 2) {
438 fprintf(stderr, "Arguments given (%u) are less than expected (2).\n\n", argc - optidx);
439 goto usage;
440 }
441 if(help_flag)
442 goto usage;
443 ret = ocsp_fetch(&opt, argc - optidx, argv + optidx);
444 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pass_strings);
445 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pool_strings);
446 return ret;
447usage:
448 arg_printusage (args, 6, "ocsp-fetch", "outfile certs ...");
449 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pass_strings);
450 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pool_strings);
451 return 0;
452}

540
541static int
542request_create_wrap(int argc, char **argv)
543{
544 struct request_create_options opt;
545 int ret;
546 int optidx = 0;
547 struct getargs args[] = {
548 { "subject", 0, arg_string, NULL, "Subject DN", NULL },
549 { "email", 0, arg_strings, NULL, "Email address in SubjectAltName", NULL },
550 { "dnsname", 0, arg_strings, NULL, "Hostname or domainname in SubjectAltName", NULL },
551 { "type", 0, arg_string, NULL, "Type of request CRMF or PKCS10, defaults to PKCS10", NULL },
552 { "key", 0, arg_string, NULL, "Key-pair", NULL },
553 { "generate-key", 0, arg_string, NULL, "keytype", NULL },
554 { "key-bits", 0, arg_integer, NULL, "number of bits in the generated key", NULL },
555 { "verbose", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "verbose status", NULL },
556 { "help", 'h', arg_flag, NULL, NULL, NULL }
557 };
558 int help_flag = 0;
559 opt.subject_string = NULL;
560 opt.email_strings.num_strings = 0;
561 opt.email_strings.strings = NULL;
562 opt.dnsname_strings.num_strings = 0;
563 opt.dnsname_strings.strings = NULL;
564 opt.type_string = NULL;
565 opt.key_string = NULL;
566 opt.generate_key_string = NULL;
567 opt.key_bits_integer = 0;
568 opt.verbose_flag = 0;
569 args[0].value = &opt.subject_string;
570 args[1].value = &opt.email_strings;
571 args[2].value = &opt.dnsname_strings;
572 args[3].value = &opt.type_string;
573 args[4].value = &opt.key_string;
574 args[5].value = &opt.generate_key_string;
575 args[6].value = &opt.key_bits_integer;
576 args[7].value = &opt.verbose_flag;
577 args[8].value = &help_flag;
578 if(getarg(args, 9, argc, argv, &optidx))
579 goto usage;
580 if(argc - optidx != 1) {
581 fprintf(stderr, "Need exactly 1 parameters (%u given).\n\n", argc - optidx);
582 goto usage;
583 }
584 if(help_flag)
585 goto usage;
586 ret = request_create(&opt, argc - optidx, argv + optidx);
587 free_getarg_strings (&opt.email_strings);
588 free_getarg_strings (&opt.dnsname_strings);
589 return ret;
590usage:
591 arg_printusage (args, 9, "request-create", "output-file");
592 free_getarg_strings (&opt.email_strings);
593 free_getarg_strings (&opt.dnsname_strings);
594 return 0;
595}
596

626static int
627query_wrap(int argc, char **argv)
628{
629 struct query_options opt;
630 int ret;
631 int optidx = 0;
632 struct getargs args[] = {
633 { "exact", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "exact match", NULL },
634 { "private-key", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "search for private key", NULL },
635 { "friendlyname", 0, arg_string, NULL, "match on friendly name", "name" },
636 { "eku", 0, arg_string, NULL, "match on EKU", "oid-string" },
637 { "expr", 0, arg_string, NULL, "match on expression", "expression" },
638 { "keyEncipherment", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "match keyEncipherment certificates", NULL },
639 { "digitalSignature", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "match digitalSignature certificates", NULL },
640 { "print", 0, arg_flag, NULL, "print matches", NULL },
641 { "pass", 0, arg_strings, NULL, "password, prompter, or environment", "password" },
642 { "help", 'h', arg_flag, NULL, NULL, NULL }
643 };
644 int help_flag = 0;
645 opt.exact_flag = 0;
646 opt.private_key_flag = 0;
647 opt.friendlyname_string = NULL;
648 opt.eku_string = NULL;
649 opt.expr_string = NULL;
650 opt.keyEncipherment_flag = 0;
651 opt.digitalSignature_flag = 0;
652 opt.print_flag = 0;
653 opt.pass_strings.num_strings = 0;
654 opt.pass_strings.strings = NULL;
655 args[0].value = &opt.exact_flag;
656 args[1].value = &opt.private_key_flag;
657 args[2].value = &opt.friendlyname_string;
658 args[3].value = &opt.eku_string;
659 args[4].value = &opt.expr_string;
660 args[5].value = &opt.keyEncipherment_flag;
661 args[6].value = &opt.digitalSignature_flag;
662 args[7].value = &opt.print_flag;
663 args[8].value = &opt.pass_strings;
664 args[9].value = &help_flag;
665 if(getarg(args, 10, argc, argv, &optidx))
666 goto usage;
667 if(argc - optidx < 1) {
668 fprintf(stderr, "Arguments given (%u) are less than expected (1).\n\n", argc - optidx);
669 goto usage;
670 }
671 if(help_flag)
672 goto usage;
673 ret = query(&opt, argc - optidx, argv + optidx);
674 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pass_strings);
675 return ret;
676usage:
677 arg_printusage (args, 10, "query", "certificates ...");
678 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pass_strings);
679 return 0;
680}

843 { "type", 0, arg_strings, NULL, "Types of certificate to issue (can be used more then once)", NULL },
844 { "lifetime", 0, arg_string, NULL, "Lifetime of certificate", NULL },

846 { "serial-number", 0, arg_string, NULL, "serial-number of certificate", NULL },
847 { "path-length", 0, arg_integer, NULL, "Maximum path length (CA and proxy certificates), -1 no limit", NULL },
848 { "hostname", 0, arg_strings, NULL, "DNS names this certificate is allowed to serve", NULL },
849 { "email", 0, arg_strings, NULL, "email addresses assigned to this certificate", NULL },
850 { "pk-init-principal", 0, arg_strings, NULL, "PK-INIT principal (for SAN)", NULL },
851 { "ms-upn", 0, arg_string, NULL, "Microsoft UPN (for SAN)", NULL },
852 { "jid", 0, arg_string, NULL, "XMPP jabber id (for SAN)", NULL },
853 { "req", 0, arg_string, NULL, "certificate request", NULL },
854 { "certificate-private-key", 0, arg_string, NULL, "private-key", NULL },
855 { "generate-key", 0, arg_string, NULL, "keytype", NULL },
856 { "key-bits", 0, arg_integer, NULL, "number of bits in the generated key", NULL },
857 { "crl-uri", 0, arg_string, NULL, "URI to CRL", NULL },
858 { "template-certificate", 0, arg_string, NULL, "certificate", NULL },
859 { "template-fields", 0, arg_string, NULL, "flag", NULL },
860 { "help", 'h', arg_flag, NULL, NULL, NULL }
861 };
862 int help_flag = 0;
863 opt.issue_ca_flag = 0;
864 opt.issue_proxy_flag = 0;
865 opt.domain_controller_flag = 0;
866 opt.subject_string = NULL;
867 opt.ca_certificate_string = NULL;
868 opt.self_signed_flag = 0;
869 opt.ca_private_key_string = NULL;
870 opt.certificate_string = NULL;
871 opt.type_strings.num_strings = 0;
872 opt.type_strings.strings = NULL;
873 opt.lifetime_string = NULL;
874 opt.signature_algorithm_string = NULL;
875 opt.serial_number_string = NULL;
876 opt.path_length_integer = -1;
877 opt.hostname_strings.num_strings = 0;
878 opt.hostname_strings.strings = NULL;
879 opt.email_strings.num_strings = 0;
880 opt.email_strings.strings = NULL;
881 opt.pk_init_principal_strings.num_strings = 0;
882 opt.pk_init_principal_strings.strings = NULL;
883 opt.ms_upn_string = NULL;
884 opt.jid_string = NULL;
885 opt.req_string = NULL;
886 opt.certificate_private_key_string = NULL;
887 opt.generate_key_string = NULL;
888 opt.key_bits_integer = 0;
889 opt.crl_uri_string = NULL;
890 opt.template_certificate_string = NULL;
891 opt.template_fields_string = NULL;
892 args[0].value = &opt.issue_ca_flag;
893 args[1].value = &opt.issue_proxy_flag;
894 args[2].value = &opt.domain_controller_flag;
895 args[3].value = &opt.subject_string;
896 args[4].value = &opt.ca_certificate_string;
897 args[5].value = &opt.self_signed_flag;
898 args[6].value = &opt.ca_private_key_string;
899 args[7].value = &opt.certificate_string;
900 args[8].value = &opt.type_strings;
901 args[9].value = &opt.lifetime_string;
902 args[10].value = &opt.signature_algorithm_string;
903 args[11].value = &opt.serial_number_string;
904 args[12].value = &opt.path_length_integer;
905 args[13].value = &opt.hostname_strings;
906 args[14].value = &opt.email_strings;
907 args[15].value = &opt.pk_init_principal_strings;
908 args[16].value = &opt.ms_upn_string;
909 args[17].value = &opt.jid_string;
910 args[18].value = &opt.req_string;
911 args[19].value = &opt.certificate_private_key_string;
912 args[20].value = &opt.generate_key_string;
913 args[21].value = &opt.key_bits_integer;
914 args[22].value = &opt.crl_uri_string;
915 args[23].value = &opt.template_certificate_string;
916 args[24].value = &opt.template_fields_string;
917 args[25].value = &help_flag;
918 if(getarg(args, 26, argc, argv, &optidx))
919 goto usage;
920 if(argc - optidx > 0) {
921 fprintf(stderr, "Arguments given (%u) are more than expected (0).\n\n", argc - optidx);
922 goto usage;
923 }
924 if(help_flag)
925 goto usage;
926 ret = hxtool_ca(&opt, argc - optidx, argv + optidx);
927 free_getarg_strings (&opt.type_strings);
928 free_getarg_strings (&opt.hostname_strings);
929 free_getarg_strings (&opt.email_strings);
930 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pk_init_principal_strings);
931 return ret;
932usage:
933 arg_printusage (args, 26, "certificate-sign", "");
934 free_getarg_strings (&opt.type_strings);
935 free_getarg_strings (&opt.hostname_strings);
936 free_getarg_strings (&opt.email_strings);
937 free_getarg_strings (&opt.pk_init_principal_strings);
938 return 0;
939}

1045
1046static int
1047help_wrap(int argc, char **argv)
1048{
1049 int ret;
1050 int optidx = 0;
1051 struct getargs args[] = {
1052 { "help", 'h', arg_flag, NULL, NULL, NULL }
1053 };
1054 int help_flag = 0;
1055 args[0].value = &help_flag;
1056 if(getarg(args, 1, argc, argv, &optidx))
1057 goto usage;
1058 if(argc - optidx > 1) {
1059 fprintf(stderr, "Arguments given (%u) are more than expected (1).\n\n", argc - optidx);
1060 goto usage;
1061 }
1062 if(argc - optidx < 0) {
1063 fprintf(stderr, "Arguments given (%u) are less than expected (0).\n\n", argc - optidx);
1064 goto usage;
1065 }
1066 if(help_flag)
1067 goto usage;
1068 ret = help(NULL, argc - optidx, argv + optidx);
1069 return ret;
1070usage:
1071 arg_printusage (args, 1, "help", "[command]");
1072 return 0;
1073}
